intro: Saldinia coursiana, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, evergreen leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in nutrient-poor, acidic soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Saldinia coursiana is adapted to coastal and high-altitude environments, showcasing resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
